#!/usr/bin/env python3

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    lengths = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
    if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths):
        print("Yes")
    else:
        print("No")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    lengths = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
    if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths):

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    lengths = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())) #list of all lengths
    if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths): #if the max length is less than the total length minus the max length, then it's possible
        print("Yes")
    else:
        print("No")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()


import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    for _ in range(n):
        lengths = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
        if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths):
            print("Yes")
        else:
            print("No")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

import sys

n = int(input())
line = list(map(int, input().split()))

print(n, line)

if max(line) < sum(line) - max(line):
    print("Yes")
else:
    print("No")


def main():
    n = int(input())
    lengths = list(map(int, input().split()))

    print("Yes" if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths) else "No")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
import sys
import math



def main():

    print("Yes" if max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths) else "No")

def main():
    n = int(input())
    lengths = list(map(int, input().split()))

    print("Yes") if (max(lengths) < sum(lengths) - max(lengths)) else print("No")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
